title: Publications
text:
Journal Articles
Edmund Kelly and James Tilley (2024). “Misconduct by voters’ own representatives does not affect voters’ generalized political trust”, British Journal of Political Science (forthcoming).

 Working papers
Edmund Kelly, James Tilley and Sven Oskarsson. “Revisiting the link between political trust and political participation” (revise and resubmit).
Abel Brodeur, Derek Mikola, Nikolai Cook et al. (inc. Edmund Kelly). “Mass reproducibility and replicability: A new hope” (under review).
Edmund Kelly and Qinya Feng. “Education and political trust”.

title: Edmund Kelly
text:
Photo credit: Fisher Studios. 
    
  
  



Thank you for visiting! I am a PhD student in the Department of Politics and International Relations at the University of Oxford. My research is funded by the Economic and Social Research Council.
I study how much people trust political authorities and politicians, how and why that changes, and the consequences of (low) political trust.
My research on how scandals affect trust in politics is forthcoming in the British Journal of Political Science. You can find the paper here.
You can also find me on Google Scholar and Twitter.
I can be contacted at: edmund.kelly@politics.ox.ac.uk.
